summary: This bill, the Emergency Relief for Federal Contractors Act of 2025, allows penalty-free distributions from retirement accounts for federal contractors and certain other individuals impacted by federal government shutdowns.  It sets a $30,000 limit, adjusted for inflation, on the aggregate amount of such distributions.  It also allows individuals to repay distributed amounts to retirement plans within three years.  The bill includes definitions for key terms like "Federal Government shutdown distribution" and "applicable individual."
